feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 3 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 2 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: System struggles with precise leap year day calculations in service duration and gratuity computations
findings.issue_explanation: Multiple tickets revealed inconsistent handling of leap year days, particularly in calculating service duration and gratuity amounts
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot automatically adjust calculations to include 366 days in leap years
findings.gap_statement: Lack of dynamic leap year day handling in financial calculations

findings.group_description: Inconsistent and complex daily wage calculation methods across different system modules
findings.issue_explanation: Different modules (Leave, Payroll, End of Service) use varying daily wage calculation methods with no standardized approach
findings.limitation_statement: No unified mechanism for configuring daily wage divisors and calculation methods
findings.gap_statement: Lack of flexible, configurable daily wage calculation framework

findings.group_description: Poor communication between Time Off and Payroll modules leads to calculation inconsistencies
findings.issue_explanation: Public holiday additions and leave request timing cause mismatches in salary deduction calculations
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot dynamically update calculations when configuration changes mid-cycle
findings.gap_statement: Modules lack real-time synchronization for accurate financial calculations

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual verification required for gratuity calculations involving leap years
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Manually verify total service days, ensuring 366 days are counted for 2024
2. Double-check calculations using both 365 and 366 day divisors
3. Confirm final amount with manual spreadsheet calculation

troubleshooting.group_description: Strategies for aligning daily wage calculations across modules
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Review global vs policy-level daily wage settings
2. Verify daily rate divisor in each module
3. Manually adjust calculations if global settings override policy configurations
4. Document specific calculation method used for each scenario

glossary.definition: The number of days used to calculate an employee's daily rate, which can vary between 30, 30.42, and 365/366 depending on system configuration
Days considered for salary calculation, which may exclude weekends and public holidays based on employee's work week configuration
